CWE.Name: Location
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are organized based on which phase they are introduced during the software development and deployment process.

CWE.Name: Configuration
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are typically introduced during the configuration of the software.

CWE.Name: Code
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are typically introduced during code development, including specification, design, and implementation.

CWE.Name: Source Code
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are typically found within source code.

CWE.Name: Time and State
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to the improper management of time and state in an environment that supports simultaneous or near-simultaneous computation by multiple systems, processes, or threads.

CWE.Name: Race Condition
CWE.Desc: The program contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.

CWE.Name: Indicator of Poor Code Quality
CWE.Desc: The code has features that do not directly introduce a weakness or vulnerability, but indicate that the product has not been carefully developed or maintained.

CWE.Name: Resource Management Errors
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to improper management of system resources.

CWE.Name: Security Features
CWE.Desc: Software security is not security software. Here we are concerned with topics like authentication, access control, confidentiality, cryptography, and privilege management.

CWE.Name: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
CWE.Desc: The software does not sufficiently verify the origin or authenticity of data, in a way that causes it to accept invalid data.

CWE.Name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
CWE.Desc: The web application does not, or can not, sufficiently verify whether a well-formed, valid, consistent request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request.

CWE.Name: Credentials Management
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to the management of credentials.

CWE.Name: Permissions, Privileges, and Access Control
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to the management of permissions, privileges, and other security features that are used to perform access control.

CWE.Name: Improper Access Control
CWE.Desc: The software does not restrict or incorrectly restricts access to a resource from an unauthorized actor.

CWE.Name: Authentication Issues
CWE.Desc: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the software does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

CWE.Name: Cryptographic Issues
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to the use of cryptography.

CWE.Name: Data Handling
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are typically found in functionality that processes data.

CWE.Name: Numeric Errors
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to improper calculation or conversion of numbers.

CWE.Name: Information Management Errors
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category are related to improper handling of sensitive information.

CWE.Name: Information Leak / Disclosure
CWE.Desc: An information exposure is the intentional or unintentional disclosure of information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.

CWE.Name: Input Validation
CWE.Desc: The product does not validate or incorrectly validates input that can affect the control flow or data flow of a program.

CWE.Name: Path Equivalence
CWE.Desc: Weaknesses in this category can be used to access files outside of a restricted directory (path traversal) or to perform operations on files that would otherwise be restricted (path equivalence).

CWE.Name: Path Traversal
CWE.Desc: The software uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the software does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside of the restricted directory.

CWE.Name: Link Following
CWE.Desc: The software attempts to access a file based on the filename, but it does not properly prevent that filename from identifying a link or shortcut that resolves to an unintended resource.

CWE.Name: Injection
CWE.Desc: The software constructs all or part of a command, data structure, or record using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify how it is parsed or interpreted when it is sent to a downstream component.

CWE.Name: Format String Vulnerability
CWE.Desc: The software uses externally-controlled format strings in printf-style functions, which can lead to buffer overflows or data representation problems.

CWE.Name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
CWE.Desc: The software does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page that is served to other users.

CWE.Name: Code Injection
CWE.Desc: The software constructs all or part of a code segment using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the syntax or behavior of the intended code segment.

CWE.Name: Command Injection
CWE.Desc: The software constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

CWE.Name: SQL Injection
CWE.Desc: The software constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended SQL command when it is sent to a downstream component.

CWE.Name: OS Command Injections
CWE.Desc: The software constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component.
